            About me
            I am a social psychology PhD candidate and research assistant at the University of Belgrade Department of Psychology (LIRA).
            My PhD project explores how people make vaccination decisions and its implications for public communication, using online experiments and media content analysis. More broadly, I am interested in how people decide to help others and contribute to the public good.
            I developed and lead LIRA’s open repository of psychological instruments in Serbian (REPOPSI).
            In my spare time, I like to draw, do #SciComm & co-organize #ScienceReadingClubBelgrade, and teach myself R. I created this website with {distill} and {postcards}.
            
            
            Research interests
            vaccination decision-making, public health communication, cooperation, altruism, economic games, social norms, intergroup bias, open science
            
            
            Education
            University of Belgrade | M.A. in Psychology
            University of Belgrade | B.A. in Psychology

articles.title: Publications
articles.description: Please contact me for full-text copies of any paywalled articles.
articles.contents:
SELECTED PEER-REVIEWED JOURNAL ARTICLES
Lazić, A., Purić, D., & Krstić, K. (2021). Does parochial cooperation exist in childhood and adolescence? A meta-analysis. International Journal of Psychology. https://doi.org/10.1002/ijop.12791
[Free Eprint] [Preprint] [Open Data] [Twitter Thread]
Lazić, A., & Žeželj, I. (2021). A systematic review of narrative interventions: Lessons for countering anti-vaccination conspiracy theories and misinformation. Public Understanding of Science. https://doi.org/10.1177/09636625211011881
[Accepted Article] [Open Data] [Twitter Thread]
Teovanović, P., Lukić, P., Zupan, Z., Lazić, A., Ninković, M., Žeželj, I. (2021). Irrational beliefs differentially predict adherence to guidelines and pseudoscientific practices during the COVID-19 pandemic. Applied Cognitive Psychology, 35(2), 486–496. https://doi.org/10.1002/acp.3770
SELECTED PEER-REVIEWED CONFERENCE PAPERS
Lazić, A., Lazarević L. B., Purić, D., & Žeželj, I. (2021). REPOPSI: The open repository of psychological instruments in Serbian. In N. Miljković, P. Pejović, & M. Cvetanović (Eds.), Proceedings of the Third National Conference with International Participation titled Application of free software and open hardware PSSOH 2020 (pp. 51–56). University of Belgrade School of Electrical Engineering and Academic Mind. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4064293
